title: Receipt Management
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement transaction receipt tracking:
- Map synthetic Eth tx hashes to Miden transaction IDs
- Implement miden_tx_to_eth_receipt() per spec line 184-205
- Poll Miden state for confirmation status
- Return Ethereum-formatted receipts with:
  - transaction_hash, block_number, block_hash
  - status 0x1 on success
  - to = BRIDGE_CONTRACT_ADDRESS

title: Restore faucet functionality, only remove deploy tx submission
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Previous change removed too much code.

RESTORE:
- All faucet functionality 
- The agglayer_faucet.rs module
- All claim processing logic

ONLY REMOVE the code that actually deploys the faucet to the network:
```rust
let deploy_tx_request = TransactionRequestBuilder::new()
    .script_arg(*auth_procedure_mast_root)
    .custom_script(auth_script)
    .build()
    ...

let faucet_deploy_result = client
    .submit_new_transaction(agglayer_faucet_id, deploy_tx_request)
    .await;
```

And any prep code specifically for building the deploy transaction.

The proxy should still handle faucet operations - it just should NOT deploy the faucet account itself.

title: Claim Tracking and Deduplication
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement claim deduplication:
- Track globalIndex values to prevent replay attacks
- Use thread-safe storage (DashSet per spec line 383-396)
- Reject duplicate claims with AlreadyClaimed error
- Persist claimed indices across restarts

This is security-critical for replay prevention.
close_reason: Implemented ClaimTracker module with DashSet storage, persistence, and tests. All 10 tests passing.

Need to: 1) Check docker logs proxy 2) Verify env vars are being passed in docker-compose.local.yml 3) Test with ./scripts/start-all.sh --clean then ./scripts/test-lumia-claims.sh 1

description: Patrol 6: Stable.

title: Remove deploy transactions from proxy - no deployments
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Remove all deployment transaction logic from the proxy.

The proxy should NOT deploy anything - it should only proxy requests. Remove:
- Faucet deployment code
- Account deployment code  
- Any other deploy tx logic

The proxy is a passthrough, not an initializer.

title: Convert Tests to Rust using miden-client
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

URGENT: Current tests are Python/pytest but must be Rust using miden-client library.

Convert all tests to Rust:
- Phase 1 tests: TC-1.1 to TC-1.7 (node connectivity, accounts, P2ID)
- Phase 2 tests: TC-2.1 to TC-2.5 (CLAIM notes, faucet)
- Phase 3 tests: TC-3.1 to TC-3.9 (integration)

Use:
- miden-client crate for Miden operations
- tokio for async
- std Rust testing framework (#[test], #[tokio::test])

Place tests in tests/ directory as Rust integration tests.
Entry: cargo test (via make test)

title: Fix miden-node URL in Docker: use service name not localhost
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Inside Docker, proxy uses localhost:57291 but should use miden-node:57291 (the Docker service name). Error: 'rpc api error' when calling GetBlockHeaderByNumber. The MIDEN_RPC_URL env var is set in docker-compose.local.yml but code defaults to localhost. Need to ensure the Docker compose passes MIDEN_RPC_URL=http://miden-node:57291

dispatched_by: mayor

title: Polecat workflow: skip compilation, let refinery be the test gate
description:
## Problem
Polecats spend 10+ minutes on cargo builds/tests for each fix. With slow Rust compilation, this wastes time.

## Proposal
Polecats should 'yolo' fixes:
- Make code changes
- Run quick syntax checks (cargo check, not cargo test)
- Submit to MR queue

Refinery becomes the single compilation/test gate:
- Runs full cargo test
- Rejects MRs that fail
- Dispatches fresh polecat for fixes if needed

## Benefits
- Faster polecat throughput
- Single point of compilation
- Polecats can context-cycle more quickly

## Risks
- More MR rejections (acceptable - refinery handles)
- Need good error reporting back to polecats

Use jsonrpsee macros for server definition.

title: Custom Kurtosis config: provision Miden infra without post-hoc patching
description:
attached_molecule: mi-wisp-76om
attached_at: 2026-01-28T14:03:47Z
dispatched_by: mayor

## Goal

Replace the current e2e-test.sh workflow that provisions vanilla kurtosis-cdk and then stops/patches/replaces containers with a custom Kurtosis params file (or package) that provisions the correct Miden bridge infrastructure directly.

## Current State (What We're Replacing)

The e2e-test.sh script currently:
1. Deploys vanilla kurtosis-cdk (includes OP-Geth/OP-Node L2 we don't need)
2. Manually adds: miden-node, miden-proxy, nginx L2-forwarder containers
3. Truncates bridge Postgres tables to force fresh L2 sync
4. Reconfigures aggkit-bridge container (sed-patches L2URL  forwarder)
5. Reconfigures zkevm-bridge-service (sed-patches L2URLs  forwarder)
6. Stops/recreates aggkit-bridge with modified config mounted as volume
7. Stops/recreates aggsender with modified config + aggoracle component
8. Adds network alias miden-l2-forwarder for DNS compat

This is ~600 lines of fragile post-provisioning shell that breaks when container names change (already happened with miden-infra namespace rename).

## Target State

A Kurtosis params YAML (or custom package) that:

### Must Have
- Deploys L1 (lighthouse/geth/anvil) + agglayer + bridge contracts (same as vanilla CDK)
- Does NOT deploy OP-Geth/OP-Node (we don't use Optimism L2)
- Includes miden-node service (image: miden-infra/miden-node:agglayer-v0.1, port 57291)
- Includes miden-proxy service (image: miden-infra/miden-proxy, port 8546, env vars: CHAIN_ID, MIDEN_RPC_URL, BRIDGE_FAUCET_ID, BRIDGE_ADDRESS, LISTEN_PORT)
- Includes nginx L2 forwarder (or configures bridge to hit proxy directly on 8545)
- Configures aggkit-bridge with L2URL pointing to proxy/forwarder from the start
- Configures zkevm-bridge-service with L2URLs pointing to proxy/forwarder
- Configures aggsender+aggoracle with correct L2URL and TargetChainType=EVM
- No post-provisioning database truncation needed (fresh deploy = clean state)

### Nice to Have
- pgweb container for bridge DB browsing
- Parameterized bridge faucet ID / bridge address
- Health checks on all services

## Key Details

### Container Network
All on kurtosis network (kt-cdk-miden). DNS via container names.

### Miden Proxy Env Vars
- CHAIN_ID=2
- MIDEN_RPC_URL=http://miden-node:57291
- MIDEN_STORE_PATH=/app/data/miden-client
- BRIDGE_FAUCET_ID=0x000000000000000000000000000001
- BRIDGE_ADDRESS=(from contract deployment)
- LISTEN_PORT=8546

### Bridge Config Changes (vs vanilla CDK)
- L2URL: http://op-el-1-op-geth-op-node-001:8545  http://miden-proxy:8545 (or forwarder)
- RPCURL: same redirect
- TargetChainType: must be "EVM" (uncommented)

### Approach Options
1. **kurtosis-cdk params file**: Use the existing CDK package's parameterization to disable OP components and add custom services. Check if kurtosis-cdk supports additional_services or custom L2 config.
2. **Fork/overlay**: Create a thin Kurtosis package that imports kurtosis-cdk and overrides the L2 layer.
3. **Standalone package**: Full custom Kurtosis package (most work but cleanest).

Option 1 is preferred if kurtosis-cdk supports enough parameterization.

## Files
- Current script: scripts/e2e-test.sh
- Kurtosis CDK: https://github.com/0xPolygon/kurtosis-cdk
- Config snapshots: scripts/.aggkit-config/, scripts/.aggkit-001-config/
notes: Implemented miden-cdk Kurtosis package that provisions Miden bridge infrastructure without post-hoc patching. Created 6 new files (~1200 lines) replacing ~600 lines of fragile shell scripting. Added Docker labels for grouping in Docker Desktop. Branch pushed: polecat/nux/mi-goam@mky3st1a
close_reason: Merged to main (ad0ee7c). New Kurtosis package at kurtosis/miden-cdk/ with simplified e2e-kurtosis.sh

title: Update Dockerfile to use exp-agglayer-v0.2 branch for miden-node
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Update Dockerfile.miden-node to clone from exp-agglayer-v0.2 branch:

```dockerfile
# Clone miden-node from exp-agglayer-v0.2 branch
# Source: https://github.com/0xMiden/miden-node
RUN git clone --depth 1 --branch exp-agglayer-v0.2 \
    https://github.com/0xMiden/miden-node.git .

# Save the miden-node commit SHA for labeling
RUN git rev-parse HEAD > /tmp/miden-node-commit.txt && \
    echo "Miden-node commit: $(cat /tmp/miden-node-commit.txt)"
```

This aligns with the proxy dependency updates to exp-agglayer-v0.2.

title: Implement GER injection flow for deposit claims
description:
## Problem
Deposits on L1 never become "ready for claim" on L2 because:
1. aggoracle sends GER injection txs to op-geth, not our proxy
2. Proxy does not handle eth_sendRawTransaction for GER storage
3. Proxy does not emit synthetic logs that bridge expects

## Current Flow
1. User deposits ETH on L1 bridge
2. L1 updates GlobalExitRoot
3. aggoracle watches L1, sends tx to L2 to inject GER
4. L2 (op-geth) processes tx, emits logs
5. Bridge sees logs -> marks deposit ready for claim

## Needed for Miden
1. Reconfigure aggoracle - Point L2URL/RPCURL to miden-l2-forwarder
   - Issue: aggkit container config is read-only
   - Solution: Modify kurtosis-cdk deployment or create custom aggkit image

2. Proxy: Handle eth_sendRawTransaction
   - Parse incoming transactions
   - Detect GER injection txs (to 0xa40D5f56745a118D0906a34E69aeC8C0Db1cB8fA)
   - Store GER in proxy state

3. Proxy: Emit synthetic logs
   - When GER is injected, emit UpdateGlobalExitRoot event
   - Bridge watches eth_getLogs for these events
   - Must match expected event signatures

## Target Address
L2 GlobalExitRoot contract: 0xa40D5f56745a118D0906a34E69aeC8C0Db1cB8fA

title: Add faucet-to-asset mapping based on origin network/token
description:
attached_molecule: mi-wisp-m83
attached_at: 2026-01-22T20:55:39Z
dispatched_by: mayor

## Context
When processing claimAsset transactions, the proxy logs show:
```
Origin network: 0
Origin token: 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000
```

Currently all claims use a single "LUMIA" faucet. We need to map different origin tokens to appropriate faucets.

## Requirements

1. **Asset Mapping Configuration**
   - WETH: Origin network=0, Origin token=0x0...0 (20 zero bytes)
   - Other known tokens: TBD
   - Unknown tokens: Map to "UNKNOWN" faucet + emit warning log

2. **Implementation**
   - Add asset mapping config (could be hardcoded initially, configurable later)
   - In `submit_claim_to_miden()`, lookup faucet based on origin_network + origin_token
   - Log warning for unknown token combinations
   - Consider: Should unknown tokens fail or proceed with default faucet?

3. **Files to modify**
   - `src/main.rs` - Add mapping lookup in claim processing
   - Consider new `src/asset_mapping.rs` module

## Example Log Line
```
2026-01-22T20:39:08.230205Z  INFO - Origin network: 0
                                  - Origin token: 0000000000000000000000000000000000000000
```
notes: Implemented: Added asset_mapping module with lookup_asset() function that maps origin_network + origin_token to asset symbols (WETH for network=0/zero-address, UNKNOWN otherwise with warning log). Integrated into submit_claim_to_miden() - now logs asset symbol for each claim. Includes 5 unit tests.

title: Web UI for agglayer deposits to Miden
description:
attached_molecule: mi-wisp-guv7
attached_at: 2026-01-29T10:25:44Z
dispatched_by: mayor

## Goal

Build a simple web UI for sending agglayer deposits (bridging ETH from L1 to Miden). Deploy it as part of the Kurtosis stack.

## Design Reference

Look and feel inspired by Gateway dashboard (~/Desktop/svg.png): clean card-based layout, purple accent color, sidebar or top nav, modern/minimal aesthetic. But this is a SIMPLE single-purpose dApp  deposit form, not a full dashboard.

## Functionality

Mirrors what `scripts/send-deposit.sh` does, but from the browser:

1. **Connect Wallet**  MetaMask, Opera, Brave, or any injected EIP-1193 provider
2. **Pick Recipient**  Input field for Miden destination address (the 15-byte hex AccountId)
3. **Pick Amount**  Input field for ETH amount (human-readable, e.g. "0.1")
4. **Send Deposit**  Calls `bridgeAsset()` on the bridge contract via the connected wallet

### bridgeAsset call details
```solidity
bridgeAsset(
  uint32 destinationNetwork,    // 2 (Miden)
  address destinationAddress,   // Miden AccountId converted: prepend 5 zero bytes to 15-byte ID
  uint256 amount,               // In wei
  address token,                // 0x0000...0000 (native ETH)
  bool forceUpdateGlobalExitRoot, // true
  bytes permitData              // 0x
)
```

The bridge contract address should be read from environment/config (default: `0xc8cbebf950b9df44d987c8619f092bea980ff038`). The UI should send ETH as `msg.value` along with the call.

### Only native token (ETH) for now
No ERC-20 token picker needed. Just ETH.

## Tech Stack

Keep it simple:
- Single-page app (vanilla JS + HTML/CSS, or lightweight framework like Vite+React if preferred)
- ethers.js or viem for wallet connection and contract interaction
- No backend needed  pure client-side dApp

## Kurtosis Integration

Package the UI as a Docker container (nginx serving static files) and add it to the Kurtosis params/config so it deploys alongside the other services. Expose on a known port (e.g. 3000 or 8080).

## Key Files for Reference
- Existing deposit script: `scripts/send-deposit.sh`
- Docker setup: `docker-compose.yml`
- Kurtosis config: check for params.yml or similar

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] UI connects to injected wallet (MetaMask etc.)
- [ ] User can enter Miden recipient address and ETH amount
- [ ] Clicking "Deposit" sends bridgeAsset tx via wallet
- [ ] Shows tx hash / confirmation after send
- [ ] Deployed as container in Kurtosis stack
- [ ] Styling matches Gateway-inspired clean look (purple accents, cards, modern)
notes: Implemented web UI for agglayer deposits. Single-page dApp (vanilla JS + ethers.js) with wallet connection, Miden address input, ETH amount, and bridgeAsset() call. Packaged as nginx Docker container. Added to Kurtosis stack (miden_services.star) and docker-compose.yml. Gateway-inspired purple accent styling.

title: Transaction Decoding
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement transaction decoding:
1. RLP decode raw Ethereum transactions using alloy-consensus
2. Parse claimAsset ABI calldata (selector 0x2cffd02e)
3. Extract parameters per spec Appendix B layout
4. Decode globalIndex bit fields:
   - mainnetFlag at bit 64
   - rollupIndex bits 32-63
   - localRootIndex bits 0-31

Handle both valid claims and reject non-claim transactions.
close_reason: Implemented transaction decoding with claimAsset ABI parsing and globalIndex bit field decoding

title: Fix BRIDGE_FAUCET_ID format - invalid hex parsing
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Error: 'Invalid bridge faucet ID: Invalid account ID hex: failed to parse hex string into account ID'

The faucet ID extracted from SQLite database is not in the correct format for miden client. Need to:
1. Check what format miden client expects (likely 16 bytes / 32 hex chars with 0x prefix?)
2. Fix the SQL query or post-processing in start-all.sh to produce correct format
3. May need to pad or format the hex string correctly

title: Build Infrastructure Setup
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Set up Cargo.toml with all dependencies from spec, Makefile with build/test targets, README with build instructions. Must enable deterministic builds on clean checkout.

Dependencies (from spec):
- jsonrpsee 0.26 with server/macros
- tokio 1 with full
- tower 0.5, tower-http 0.6 with cors
- alloy-primitives 0.8, alloy-rlp 0.3, alloy-rpc-types 0.8, alloy-consensus 0.8
- miden-client 0.12 with tonic/concurrent
- miden-client-sqlite-store 0.12
- miden-objects 0.12, miden-lib 0.12, miden-crypto 0.13
- serde 1 with derive, serde_json 1, hex 0.4
- anyhow 1, thiserror 2, tracing 0.1, tracing-subscriber 0.3

Makefile targets: build, test, test-phase1, test-phase2, test-phase3, test-docker
close_reason: Build infrastructure complete: Cargo.toml, Makefile, README, src/lib.rs

title: Treat agglayer faucet as basic public account
description:
attached_molecule: mi-wisp-14l
attached_at: 2026-01-28T09:05:21Z
dispatched_by: mayor

Per miden team feedback: instead of treating the agglayer faucet as a network faucet, treat it as a basic public account.

**Change in agglayer_faucet.rs (line ~226):**

FROM:
```rust
let agglayer_faucet = create_agglayer_faucet(
    faucet_seed,
    "LUMIA",
    8,
    Felt::new(u64::MAX),
    bridge_account_id,
);
```

TO:
```rust
let agglayer_faucet = create_agglayer_faucet_builder(
    faucet_seed,
    "LUMIA",
    8,
    Felt::new(u64::MAX),
    bridge_account_id,
)
.storage_mode(AccountStorageMode::Public)
.with_component(BasicWallet)
.with_auth_component(AccountComponent::from(NoAuth))
.build()?;
```

**Required imports to add:**
- `use miden_client::account::component::BasicWallet;`
- `use miden_protocol::account::{AccountStorageMode, AccountComponent};`
- `use miden_client::auth::NoAuth;`

**Note:** The function signature will need to return Result now since .build() returns Result. Update error handling accordingly.

Reference: https://github.com/partylikeits1983/agglayer-devnet-debug-example/blob/main/src/main.rs

dispatched_by: mayor

Use deterministic derivation as fallback:
eth_address -> keccak256 -> seed -> AccountId

title: Move kurtosis.yml to repo root so web-ui and proxy are inside package scope
description:
attached_molecule: mi-wisp-lhlb
attached_at: 2026-01-29T11:41:12Z
dispatched_by: mayor

Kurtosis fails with: '/web-ui/Dockerfile' doesn't exist in the package 'mandrigin/aggkit-proxy'. Root cause: kurtosis.yml lives in kurtosis/miden-cdk/ but web-ui/ is at repo root, outside the package boundary. Fix: 1) Move kurtosis.yml to the repo root (change package name accordingly). 2) Update all relative paths in star files (main.star, miden_services.star, etc.) to reference from repo root instead of kurtosis/miden-cdk/. 3) Verify web-ui build and proxy rebuild both work with the new package scope. Key file: miden_services.star:255 build_context_dir='../../web-ui' needs to become a path relative to the new package root.

title: Bridge-service L2 sync stuck in reorg loop due to inconsistent block hashes
description:
attached_molecule: mi-wisp-zix
attached_at: 2026-01-22T21:13:47Z
dispatched_by: mayor

## Symptoms
- Bridge-service keeps detecting 'reorg' on L2 (Miden proxy)
- Constantly reverts between blocks 88 and 91
- `ready_for_claim` doesn't update for new deposits
- New claims can't be processed
- Duplicate key errors on re-processed blocks

## Error Logs
```
NetworkID: 2, REORG: Looking for the latest correct ethereum block. Depth: 1
NetworkID: 2. Reverting synchronization to block: 0
ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "claim_pkey"
```

## Root Cause
Synthetic block hashes from miden-proxy may be inconsistent between calls for the same block number. When bridge-service re-queries a block, it gets a different hash, triggering reorg detection.

## Files to Investigate
- `src/block_state.rs` - Block hash generation and storage
- Need to ensure block hashes are deterministic based on block number

## Impact
- P1: Blocks all claims after initial batch
- 45 deposits sent, only 11 processed (first batch before reorg detection started)

## Workaround
None known - restarting proxy doesn't help as new blocks get new random hashes
